title: To the Sea
lyrics:
I'll be waiting in the car
Don't forget the camera
If you wouldn't mind could you find my yellow shoes
I think they're under the stairs
Fa la la la fa la
Through the hills and country side

Waving at the passers by

There's old tom in a coat and tie looking every [?]

The prince

He [?] the bucket to the fence

Fa la la la fa la

Fa la la la fa la



We drove to the sea

Where the water is green

And the clouds and the blue through the shadows of me and you

The shells that we found in the sand

The moment we held in our hands

You were making me laugh, it was easier then, when

But then again



I'll be over there

Cozy in my folding chair

Watching seabirds in the air as they circle the sun

[?] they suffer no one

Fa la la la fa la

Fa la la la fa la



We drove to the sea

Where the water is green

And the clouds and the blue through the shadows of me and you

The shells that we found in the sand

The moment we held in our hands

You were making me smile, it was easier then, when

But then again



All of the questions in my head

I'll make them read

Put them to bed

All of the voices in my mind

Hurt and unkind

Leave them behind (leave them behind)

All we drove to the sea



And the water is green

And the clouds and the blue through the shadows of me and you

The shells that we found in the sand

The moment we held in our hands

You were making me smile, it was easier then, when

But then again



I'll be waiting in the car

Don't forget the camera

If you wouldn't mind could you find my yellow shoes

I think they're under the stairs

Fa la la la fa la

Fa la la la fa la

Fa la la la fa la

Fa la la la fa la
